reviews.text: It is also known as Amer fort.  A historical destination in Jaipur.  Beautifully designed and architect.  It is a huge place with a lot of enclaves.  My favorite is the glass room with walls made from mosaic of mirrors. Also there is an elephant 🐘 ride which were awesome.

It is also known as Amer fort. What a wonderful fort it is. You just get amazed with its architecture, carvings and paintings. I loved this fort most in Jaipur Rajasthan. You get an awesome view from the top. You just get a glimpse of how the Royals must have lived. I was so much fascinated by its beauty. I will highly recommend everyone to visit this place if you are in Jaipur.

Wonderful old palace full of history. It's advisable to have a guide to be able to appreciate this incredible building. Do not use elephants to take you up to the palace, it is cruel and very hot for them to go up the steep hill. This practice should be stopped.

A historical destination in Jaipur. Beautifully designed and architect. A must visiting site with family and friends.Great monument of the ancient Indian architecture. The fun part of the visiting of the Amber palace is elephant ride from the parking place to the palace. The palace itself is better to visit with the guide. So, you can enjoy not only the views but also have a chance to find out some interesting facts.

One of the popular forts in Jaipur. It is situated at a high altitude. You can even drive your car on the ramp or walk or have a elephant ride till its gate. Its a must visit place in Jaipur. Its having great ancient architecture. It is around 11km from Jaipur city

It is a beautiful place in Jaipur. The best place which I liked most in Jaipur. Went there for sunset. And the view from above was beautiful. You can go with your bike or car.

 They way is also good where you can see scenic beauty. You will be able to see the entire city from the top of the mountain where you can feel the cool breeze during winter and a great feel. And you can enjoy the history of Jaipur😁

Best place to visit if you love heights along with heritage. 
450meters+ height with amazing view of PINK CITY. One of the best places in Jaipur. Nahargarh is one of the three forts in Jaipur.

 There is View Point from where you can see the whole city. There's Sun Rise point, Sunset Point, Jaipur Wax Museum, And The Cafe which is open for Night view from the top point of Nahargarh Fort. 

In short, Amazing place.

Happy journey 😊

Awesome place for picnic and evening out. It's the highest place of Jaipur from where you can see entire Jaipur. 
So many movies have been shooted over here. 
It's good location to spend time with your family ,friends and loving one.
People prefer to go in groups.
In the night you can see a awesome view of Jaipur like a shiny city.
Whole year is the good time to visit this place but in summers evening would be great time.

One of the best place in Jaipur. Enjoy the sunset on top of the city. City view is the major attraction of this palace. I had my best dinner with sparkling Jaipur in the night. Padav restaurant in the end of Nahargarh fort will give you the best view of the city from the top. This fort is surrounded by huge boundary walls so sit and relax at any of the watch tower and feel the breeze.

Super awesome views of the city. You can walk from Nahargarh Palace Hotel (on the ground next to the hill) to the top in about 20-30 minutes. Would recommend, since it's free and has great views. Also it's much faster and cheaper than going via the Amer area. Only downside is that the entrance to the fort is a little too touristy for my taste (many shops and a random wax museum). Might be nice for others though.

Nice place to spend some time. The nine Chambers or places of the queens are great to visit. The rooftop of the fort is a nice place to hang around and get a good view of the Jaipur city. The sunset view from here is amazing.

It is good to be there. At present we can only have a look at it from roadside. But it's location amidst the water is nice to see. And boating facility good if it is reopened. At present we are free to have a look at it from the roadside. No need of paying money for visiting the place or for the parking.

It is good to be there. At present we can only have a look at it from roadside. But it's location amidst the water is nice to see. And boating facility good if it is reopened. At present we are free to have a look at it from the roadside. No need of paying money for visiting the place or for the parking.

Possibly the most serene sight amidst the chaos of Jaipur is the beautiful Jal Mahal Jaipur, the Water Palace. This low-rise symmetrical palace, that once was a shooting lodge for the Maharajah, appears to float in the centre of Sagar Lake. The light sand coloured stone walls of the Jal Mahal Jaipur are at a stark contrast to the deep blue of the waters of the lake, while from the innards of the palace lush foliage sprouts.

This majestic scene makes the Jal Mahal Jaipur’s most photographed (and photograph friendly) monument but unfortunately exploration of the actual palace is off limits to the majority of visitors as it is to be transformed into an ultra exclusive restaurant.

Wonderful tourist attraction. Structure and surroundings look magnificent during day as well as night. You can find numerous migratory birds in day time. At present we can only have a look at it from roadside. But it's location amidst the water is nice to see.

A beautiful structure located in the middle of a lake. The building has a garden at top level and trees are seen from distant. The building creates a majestic view at night when the reflection of the building is seen into the water. This is also one of the top tourist spots of Jaipur.

Nice ambience and calm atmosphere where we can give rest to our minds and enjoy moments with family or friends. Before visiting please note the timings 05Am - 12:45Pm with various Jhankis and 04:30Pm till10:00Pm. Nearby you can visit tourist places and enjoy your day... have fun
Best place to visit in Jaipur, very peaceful place. Just visit this temple once and you will fall in love with lord krishna. This temple has historic story.
Very good temple in Jaipur. Well maintained. Neat and clean. Maintains timings for jhankis. A must visit for faithfuls
A must for all those god loving people. The evening prayer is so soothing and spirited that it will make your heart sing. A must if you are near pink city.
Great facilities so that you don't have to wait in queue for long even if people are large in number.

Like every religious place this temple also has that amazing positive vibrations to which people are attracted and come here frequently to feel it. I'm also one of those people. On other aspect I would like to say that people who are selling outside the temple have become very very aggressive in their marketing(some times they even grab your hand and try to pull you to their shops to make sure that you buy sweets and other things for offering from that shop only), it may be because of the competition around them, but I personally don't feel it's not good.

The only problem I can mention is drinking water availability here, especially there is a government made purified water supply system which was not working since a few months......also in temple the available water cannot be considered for drinking for travelers.

Fabulous place, you can feel something special here. The artistically design of temple with complete golden attire looked very unique for a Ganesh temple. 

Structure, location vibes everything is lovely here.

"Nice location clean place parking available near to main road.
"The clean and hygienic environment for the lord of the lords, Sree Ganesha.

In short and sweet - fabulous 😊☺️.

This is the Oldest and most renowned  temple of Lord Ganesha  in Jaipur. There are 4-5 temples near the main temple that makes the whole area devotional. Jaipuriets directly go to this temple after buying new two or four wheeler.
Must visit place for Ganesha devotees. Huge statue in vermilion. Parking space available nearby. Best time morning or late evening. Combine with visit to Birla temple

Very famous Temple of god Ganesha  of Jaipur city .
God Ganesha big statue big and look very attractive.

Thousand new people visit here in  one year . 
Jaipur city all function and new cars , bike  starting with his taking bless . 

Jaipur city have big faith in this Temple because Temple is many year old. 

We also must visit here .

It is a historical place. Hawa Mahal is a beautiful structure predominantly a high wall made up of red sandstone. Good to know about some history. Guides are available @200 and are of very much helpful. If you have no idea, better to go with Guide. The visiting time closes at 4:30pm. DO HIT THE LIKE BUTTON IF THIS WAS HELPFUL.

Hawa Mahal is a beautiful structure predominantly a high wall made up of red sandstone. The visiting time closes at 4:30pm. But the best time to visit according to me is in the evening. In the evening the yellow lights is flashed on the wall and its the most beautiful site. People come here for sightseeing the beautiful colours that the wall has to give. The Mahal is in the streets so it attracts a lot of crowd and traffic

Nice Hawa Mahal is a beautiful structure predominantly a high wall made up of red sandstone. The visiting time closes at 4:30pm. But the best time to visit according to me is in the evening. In the evening the yellow lights is flashed on the wall and its the most beautiful site. People come here for sightseeing the beautiful colours that the wall has to give. The Mahal is in the streets so it attracts a lot of crowd and traffic

It is a historical place. It us built in form of wall as the ladies used to watch road fests from there.
Name is very justified. Even the loo feels cool there. Amazing views from the top floor. Amazing infrastructure. Too many windows which gives  really cool atmosphere .

Nice place. It's name justify this place. Place is very cool even on summers. You can feel the cool breeze from every   window.
It it not wheel chair accessible.
There are 6-8 sculptures belong to 8 B.C to 17A.D
If you are a history lover then you will like this place. If you have some history knowledge then you will enjoy then other people.
It cost you only 50 rs.

If you are interested in science and history then you should visit this place. It is not as grand as Jantar Mantar of Jaipur but has most of the instruments. It was built to keep time and observe the night sky. All instruments still work but as they are based on geocentric theory they are not useful. And also now we have much better instruments for time keeping. Time when it was built, it was state of the art technology. You need few hours to explore all the instruments.

It is a nice place to visit during the free time. The history of the place (time,longitude,latitude watch) might attract you if you're interested in all these. And people who are not interested in history then you can enjoy the gardens, sit there with your loved ones and enjoy some quality time.

I have never seen before this type of modern architecture, who's significance is not known to many people that it was used to measure the 
1. Real time of the day, 
2. Time before sun rise or subset, 
3. Local time at different places,
4. Height of sun from Earth
5. Distance of different planet and galaxies etc. and many more

I was amazing to see and know about it, and I feel myself proud as an Indian.
But govt. need to keep it care and maintained it properly as it is one of the oldest and archaeologist monument of our nation.

I have never seen before this type of modern architecture, who's significance is not known to many people that it was used to measure the 
1. Real time of the day, 
2. Time before sun rise or subset, 
3. Local time at different places,
4. Height of sun from Earth
5. Distance of different planet and galaxies etc. and many more

I was amazing to see and know about it, and I feel myself proud as an Indian.
But govt. need to keep it care and maintained it properly as it is one of the oldest and archaeologist monument of our nation.

The place holds scientific importance. Though situated in the heart of the city it is very badly maintained. The monuments need repairing and painting. The garden area could be more nicely modified to make it more beautiful. It is a nice place to spend valuable time in group.
It is an awesome place having many trees and plants it is a garden and many types of birds are present over here. One can spend his or her quality time with his loved ones.
It was one of the beautiful bagh or garden near city but now most of the part of this garden converted in Parking area. only surrounding area of albert hall has a garden and grass.

Beautiful parks and series of gardens around Albert hall. Cleaner, no. Of options are there to spend your time. The new highlight being the ‘Sawan bhado’ park which has botanical garden, garden of seasons, and so many other natural stuff with fountains which are more than half sanctuary old. Another attraction being the ‘Masala chowk’ where you have the taste of best street foods of Jaipur under one roof.
Nice but they don't follow time schedule (opening & close)
If you are looking for best budget park than I can promise this will be one of the best.

Once upon a time at The Bagh is one of the most luxury places in Jaipur to have a lovely dinner. The ambience is so royal that you feel like a king . Must try!
The food is great too!

Quiet and peaceful place. If you go there please check the restaurant at the end. It's an old Palace that was recently renovated and turned into a bar/restaurant with terrace. Prices are more expensive than average but it's affordable for tourist. It's really worth it visiting and staff there is super friendly.
Royal heritage experience, nice restaurant n good food.

A cafe with heritage look n feel is the main attraction.. the 4 star is for the venue. I didn't liked the food. It was just Okies. Recommend to visit one during evening time. You and your family will enjoy the venue for sure.
Very few choices in menu.......pls.increase more variety

Very well organized museum about local block printing. Inside a beautiful haveli house, the museum has also a little garden where you can have some drinks or snacks, an oasis from all hustle of Amber fort area. Besides all the nice exhibits you can also watch three crafts master on work, really interesting! The museum shop carries some interesting items, I bought a traditional textile board game and a bag to be hand-printed. Must visit if you’re interested in textile.

This museum is a must visit for all the craft & block print lovers. Anokhi Museum houses the world's best block painting garments and is a cultural endeavor of Anokhi clothing brand. This museum exhibits the oldest art form of Rajasthani art at its very best. Detailed explanation about every cloth is mentioned along with the quality of fabric and various other details.

It's museum situated in old Town of Amber it showcase and  explains the history and development of block printing in or around Jaipur , There is entry charges one Can visit if somebody is interested in textile history and have sufficient extra time for the visit of Jaipur other important monuments .

A beautifully renovated building, lovingly restored with great attention to detail by local artisans and craftsmen. A great Collection of hand block printing. A very tranquil place to visit. I highly recommend .

Highly recommend visiting this museum.  Close to the Amber Fort and a small step well,  it's housed in a restored haveli and has wonderful hand block printed textiles and garments on display and offers the opportunity to try the craft.

It is also known as Amer fort.  A historical destination in Jaipur.  Beautifully designed and architect.  It is a huge place with a lot of enclaves.  My favorite is the glass room with walls made from mosaic of mirrors. Also there is an elephant 🐘 ride which were awesome.

It is also known as Amer fort. What a wonderful fort it is. You just get amazed with its architecture, carvings and paintings. I loved this fort most in Jaipur Rajasthan. You get an awesome view from the top. You just get a glimpse of how the Royals must have lived. I was so much fascinated by its beauty. I will highly recommend everyone to visit this place if you are in Jaipur.

Wonderful old palace full of history. It's advisable to have a guide to be able to appreciate this incredible building. Do not use elephants to take you up to the palace, it is cruel and very hot for them to go up the steep hill. This practice should be stopped.

The fun part of the visiting of the Amber palace is elephant ride from the parking place to the palace. The palace itself is better to visit with the guide. So, you can enjoy not only the views but also have a chance to find out some interesting facts.

You get an awesome view from the top. You just get a glimpse of how the Royals must have lived. I was so much fascinated by its beauty. I will highly recommend everyone to visit this place if you are in Jaipur.

A historical destination in Jaipur. Beautifully designed and architect. A must visiting site with family and friends.Great monument of the ancient Indian architecture. The fun part of the visiting of the Amber palace is elephant ride from the parking place to the palace. The palace itself is better to visit with the guide. So, you can enjoy not only the views but also have a chance to find out some interesting facts.

One of the popular forts in Jaipur. It is situated at a high altitude. You can even drive your car on the ramp or walk or have a elephant ride till its gate. Its a must visit place in Jaipur. Its having great ancient architecture. It is around 11km from Jaipur city

Food:
Food quality is good and taste is also okay (definitely not the best!).
Nevertheless, prices are bit higher comparing to other local restaurants.

Environment:
One of the nicest eatery of Chittagong city in terms of interior decoration. They have sufficient space and setting is quite good.
You won't be bothered with loud noises.
Again, stuffs are well behaved.

Location:
Situation at city's commercial hub, Agrabad. Therefore easily accessible.
Lovely place. It has a very beautiful environment. The staff's behaviour is very polite. Food quality is great.

Very good quality foods...great restaurant to held some party....like wedding.birthday.seminar.etc.
Waiters have very good behavior...
I have ordered Chinese food.chinese food was so good
There service is very good...
There food quality is great
It is nice restaurant. Buffett available here . Anybody choose it for his personal or family program. It's service quick and all the buddies are cordial.
Nice place to have good & testy food. Quality of food & service is very good. We have a conference in their. It was a good experience about the restaurant.

Nice ambiance. Book your table in advance even if it’s a weekday as many foreigners are there so it can be crowded on a weekday as well. Indian food is yummy. There is no lift and the stairs are gigantic so would not recommend to elders.

Awesome food! Reaching is a bit problem as it is on the third floor and there is no lift. The tandoori food is excellent and the chicken salad is a must try. I would recommend this as a good spot for having lunch and dinner.

One of the best restaurants in Jaipur. Lovely ambiance and view, very popular among foreigners. Restaurant is on third and fourth floor. They don't have an elevator so it's difficult for old age people to reach at the top. They have live music and it's always crowded. Must visit.

It's a rooftop restaurant which is quite common practice in Jaipur. But this one is one of it's kind.. Great ambience. Not very spacy but the location has been excellently used. In fact there are two level of rooftops like a balcony above one rooftop. Both have seating space. When we visited the restaurant in January for a family dinner then majority of visitors were foreigners..Food quality is also excellent. Presentation is appreciable.. Recommended for a dine out.

Definitely a must when in Jaipur! Great ambience, great service and delicious food! It might be a bit more expensive than other places but the quality of the food is excellent so it's definitely worth it!

This is a different concept. Food is tasty but very oily. They will give you a lot of variety so ask if there's something more, it gets really difficult to eat all that stuff. Staff is good. Well taken care of. Although, we were just 2 persons, they provided us with everything they did years ago, when I was there in a big group of 100 persons. Excellent. Just vegetables could be better prepared.

This is awesome place to have a visit with your family and friends great interior and also having a traditional theme banquet
This place is surely a visit worthy
Having a swimming pool , some small amusement place like things 
Also great for having wedding in Jaipur 
Having both big and small gardens for wedding and parties 
Loved this place do visit if you want to have a fun time with family and friends
And also if you want to have a quality time with them.......🙂🙂☺️☺️😀😀😀
No proper management, food is not upto the mark, only kheer and maalpua was good, paneer used in veg was very low in quality.
Good food and an awesome place, the way in which they serve food is the thing i liked most and the food too

Place was ok... Good for hosting 200 people gathering.. Food was having a Rajasthani touch but in taste it wasn't up to the mark.... One can feel and go through the village culture there... Over all an ok experience...

The experience at Handi Restaurant is good.we got Good quality of food. The restaurant is well organized. We got our food on time. Every thing was so deliciously prepared and served. The response of wetters was nice. I recommend this restaurant for quality food.

Amazing non veg restaurant in Jaipur. We really enjoyed the dinner on the roof top restaurants of the Handi Restaurant.

There was a dim light ambiance with light music and wonderful person who was serving the meals. He very nicely explained about the each dishes we identified for order.

So whole ambiance was the perfect for a dinner with a relaxing music
Awesome ambience. Food was good. I went there with my friends and i had good experience. The sitting area is enough. Service was fast and good. Guys were responsive.

Its in middle of nowhere. Desert all around . But the hotel is gorgeous and its like a palace. Total wotth for the money you pay. It has one of the best swimming pools and the happy hours is also good. Although when you get out of the hotel you might not find too many places to eat or shop. And transportation may also be a challenge. But when you return back to your room , its AMAZING
Had the famous 'handi' meat which is stewed mutton curry. While it was very tasty the restaurant was rather tight on portions. 2500rs for two main courses and water.

Don't order from here as if you fall asleep you don't get your order or your money back so please don't order from little Italy pizza really bad review go to pizza hut as its a lot better than this place

I moved out of Aberdeen a year ago and what a loss it is not to have Little Italy around.. I simply cannot find a pizza restaurant with the same quality pizzas as this.

Expand! And for every newcomers, I highly recommend the Little Italy Calzone 12" if you like a bit spicy food!
Their sizes are a bit on the small side but otherwise great value for your money.

I went and ordered food throigh their website. The order was rejected due to them being too busy which I totally understand. However they proceeded to charge me twice and took the money out of my account. I emailed them and have not received any response. I am really not happy with this and this is slmesomet that people need to be avare off

The pizza is very good. I would say 7/10. I have tried the piri piri one and calzone. The number of ingredients in calzone is perfect. No option to order garlic sauce. Only garlic mayo available which taste very average. It is so easy to make garlic sauce, it should be a problem for the pizza place. The delivery time was shocking, 1:35, during the week. I cannot imagine waiting time during the peak times. Furthermore, the place is quite dear. It is not real Italian pizza therefore price should be lower. Why do I need to pay extra fee while ordering online through your website. I see the potential but some changes must be done.

Place is good. Aroma is elegant. And service is also good. But if you are going their then must try KitKat shake. Shake is really very awesome 👌. As their are so many options like Lebanese food and so many other. Garlic bread is very well prepared and baked. They provide good hospitality for their customers. And even their are so many people who use to visit this place regularly.

This restaurant is a quiet place. If you want to have a peaceful time while having a delicious meal, then this is the place. 
It’s located in the heart of the city and this place serves really good food at reasonable prices.

The place is quite Trendy and well made. The Food is good and pricing is medium.
The overall ambience and music is good, the staff seem polite but unfortunately I didn't find them warm. Having to constantly hunt for a waiter can become bothersome.
.
Its a good place to come for a date, a chill with friends or family. The paneer Lababdar was what we ordered there and it was good.

For pasta lovers, Pink sauce pasta is must try. 
-Pasta sauce was heavenly delicious. 
-Quesadilla was okay okay.
-Pizza was fine and you can have it as it will not gonna disappoint you.

I really liked the ambiance,the idea of giving the place a vintage look is quite impressive😍
The food was really great, though service was average.
Everything i tried was beyond amazing, i would really love to try their food again and again whenever i visit them next🤗🤗One more important thing, it's on 1st floor and entry is from the main gate of the building.Place is neat and clean and is spacious. Special mention of their hand towels given as these are of very high quality, which shows the investment done in the thought towards service. Overall a great experience.
Super delicious tasty oreo baked Cheese Cake With Berry compote ... Try Once .. Great Service By Mr Sohan 🤝🏻😋

Very wide variety of cuisine in the buffet.
Taste wise also food is good & served to your satisfaction.
Okra is Jaipur's one most beautiful and good  food place go there and enjoy there you will never forget that restaurant.
fine dining restaurant in Jaipur Marriott hotel open 24hours
can increase the spread for sure. Food quality, taste and presentation is good. You can count the number of starters on your fingers. 80% Indian cuisine.
Amazing experience.  Delicious food.  Bit expensive but if you're looking for Royal treatment,  then  you must not miss this place while in Jaipur.

My wife and I came for dinner here. We originally had a table on the terrace booked, but had to move indoors because of rain and wind. Nonetheless, this did not take away from the exceptional level of service we received from Rajpal Singh and Navratan Singh. These guys were super friendly and welcoming and we made conversations easily. They looked after us like I haven’t experienced anywhere before. The food was great. Flavor was on point. The ambiance of this place very royal so be dressy when you show up here. We left with our bellies full and would come back here. Keep in mind you will have to pay an entrance fee for the palace to get to this restaurant.
Most romantic restaurant in the palace. You will feel like a Royal attire...
Two star only for ambience/location. Went around 6:30 PM and ordered few veg nonveg starters. Food was below par and too expensive.
Place is very very nice .staff is very good too. But food do not deserve the place

Lovely Indian restaurant in the Jai Mahal Palace. Food was excellent & fairly priced there were 5 in our party & we all had either  mixed meat or  vegetable thali which were large & would have probably served
 2 after having poppadoms, pickles & other nibbles to start. Recommended. Photos on Jai Mahal Palace review.

Outstanding!

We had a wonderful meal at Cinnamon this evening in Jaipur. The decor is fabulous. The food, with four regions of India to choose from, was excellent and we enjoyed all of our Rajistani selections. The service was excellent. We will likely go again before we leave Jaipur.

We were greeted warmly on arrival by the most helpful waiter who was delightful the whole evening. The atmosphere and the decor added to the overall positive experience. If I had to base the review on food alone, I would give it full stars - the curry was amazing and we would definitely come back to Jaipur for the food at Cinnamon alone!
Great dining experience in Jaipur. Highly recommend the food and service.

Over priced menu.  But excellent ambience and services.  
Be prepared for a, delay in ur food orders.  Go with enough time in hand to enjoy, and sink into the oppulence.

Visited niros after more than forty years. Ambiance is same old oriental ....what it used to be in seventies. Some changes in interiors and seating arrangement. The staff faces are changed but the warmth and courtesy remains the same. Food still tastes good. Loved the visit.

Few Excellent & Few Improvement Areas! 

Well, no doubt that this is one of the top restaurants in Jaipur and it has signature dishes to be tried but you may have to be specific to what you want to eat if you're visiting a speciality restaurant. They have excellent Butter Chicken but note that it's a bit sweet tomato gravy...Then Dal/Mushroom etc are tasty and enjoyable! If you're looking for a calm place, this may not be the one... Hospitality is great and make sure that you get leftovers packed for the buggers/hungry people....

We went to niros for it's high acclaim and huge brand name but the food was immensely disappointing in terms of taste, quantity and value for money.
Everything we ordered was highly generic in taste and had no special flavour. The staff was polite and helpful,but I would never recommend this place only for it's name.
Great food. 5 star rates though. Good quantity. Old school Jaipur fine dine. Do try the butter chicken. It is authentic!

The food was good, if not spectacular. 
However, while we were there, we noted that everyone, including us, were all tourists - not a local in sight. 
That of course is because they know that you can get equally good food for about half the price nearby.   Compared to the US or UK, it is still reasonably priced
So, if you want a guaranteed good meal and don't mind paying slightly over the odds, it's okay.
